text: has anyone ever noticed the Google Site Search module relies on javascript in order to work?
When loading jQuery in the footer it errors because jQuery is not defined.
can we get this module updated to not require javascript? just make the form semantic and it'd work fine...
what I mean by that specifically: add an `action` attribute to the form and use a `<button type="submit">` instead of a link
and it'd be good to go without the js

I think HS devs standpoint on it right now would probably be either “let’s just disable the module for future HS accounts” or suggest ” you could use the HubSpot Search module” or “great idea, have you tried cloning in the new design manager”

But in a polite way.
Because I think they’re trying to kinda move away from the google search thing
yeah i get that. but it's also a change that would take like 5 minutes to make
and plenty of sites still use the old google search module on their 404 pages
which stop working after moving jquery to footer
Also valid
Does anyone know how to use an anchor tag to link to a specific tab in tabbed content? I can't seem to get any of it to work
depends if your tabs support that or not
a lot of tabs aren't built to check for on page load but only on click
how do i know what my tabs support?
would that be part of HubSpot?
in the javascript for those tabs, do you see anything that checks for the hash on page load?
nope.
so i am guessing that means not supported
yeah
but they do use hashes i assume, right?
if so it wouldn't be too hard to add support to them
<https://www.benefitexpress.info/hr-administration-webinars>
I am trying to be able to use a link to open the on-demand tab from an external email
It uses the hashes on the menu items

<mailto:youraddress@tacobell.com>
This what you’re trying to do?
<https://www.benefitexpress.info/hr-administration-webinars#tab-2>
ohhhh sorry confused myself reading the part about external email
np
Just want to be able to give a link to someone and it open that tab
`document.location.hash` will grab the hash from the page url
I’ve seen someone do this with css only but I’d personally just use JS and check on load if there’s a hash, and if there’s a hash set the active tab
add a function to the tabs that checks for a hash and activates that tab
looking for something in google like that now
so I found some code but when I goto <https://www.benefitexpress.info/hr-administration-webinars#tab-2> it shows the first tab also and breaks my upcoming/on-demand menu for some reason
It says `$(...).tab is not a function`
It doesn't seem that `$.fn.tab` is defined, so you should check the syntax on that
